JOUR328B - Special Topics in News Writing & Reporting: Sports Reporting and Writing

Resources to support class assignments in Prof. Kevin Blackistone's Jour328B course.

Contacting University Archives

For individual assistance with athletics materials in the University Archives, contact:

University Archivist Anne Turkos (aturkos@umd.edu or 301-405-9060)

or Assistant University Archivist Jason Speck (jgspeck@umd.edu or 301-405-9297)

or Athletics Archivist Amanda Hawk (ahawk@umd.edu or  301-314-3287)

Visiting Special Collections

For more information on visiting Special Collections and accessing materials from the University Archives, see: 

  • Special Collections and University Archives

Maryland Athletics Materials in Special Collections

Hornbake Library houses a variety of archival materials on the history of athletics at the University of Maryland. Several starting points for research are:

  • Sports in Maryland
    An introduction to the UM Libraries' Special Collections resources available related to the topic of Sports in Maryland.
  • Finding Aid for University of Maryland Athletics holdings in the University Archives
    An extensive guide to materials available in the University Archives on the topic of athletics. Includes suggested reference titles and websites of note.
  • Finding aid for the Queen's Game
    Research guide to materials available in the Archives surrounding the "Queen's Game" (October 19, 1957, Maryland Terrapins vs. University of North Carolina Tar Heels) attended by Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth II and His Royal Highness, Prince Philip.
  • UM Football Media Guides (1940-2008)
    Digitized copies of media guides for the UM Football program.
  • UM Men's Basketball Media Guides (1955-2009)
    Digitized copies of media guides for the UM Men's Basketball team.
  • Selected List of Journalism Holdings in the Archives and Manuscripts Department, University of Maryland Libraries
  • University AlbUM
    Digital collection of University of Maryland Resources. Browse by decade or review the Sport section.

Additional Special Collections

In addition to the materials housed at Hornbake related to journalism and journalism history, the Libraries have many other Special Collections to support your research:

  • University Archives
  • Digital Collections
  • State of Maryland Resources
  • Literature and Rare Books
  • Library Media Services
  • U.S. Government Information, Maps, & GIS Services
